definitions: To push, fold, or turn under or between other things.
To draw, fold, or turn up (a part of a garment, etc.) so as to shorten or secure it.
To put into a snug, safe, or concealed place.
To make a tuck or tucks in (a garment).
examples: She tucked her shirt into her pants.
He tucked the blanket around the baby.
Tuck your knees up to your chest.
She tucked the letter into her pocket.
